revised_title: The Founding and Early Years of the Philosophical Transactions
tldr: The article discusses the origins and early days of the Philosophical Transactions, the world's first scientific journal. It highlights the role of Henry Oldenburg, a key figure in the early history of the Royal Society, who was responsible for composing and publishing the journal. The article also provides insights into the journal's content, which covered a wide range of scientific topics and discoveries of the time.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
